body_html:
I have the same problem in TF r1.2 and Python 3.5. If I try to use tf.contrib.keras.layers.TimeDistributed, the same error happens. But if I add the code
from tensorflow.contrib.keras.python.keras.layers.wrappers import TimeDistributed
I can use TimeDistributed.

When I use TimeDistributed, I meet another trouble.
from tensorflow.contrib.keras import layers as KL
x = KL.Input(batch_shape=[1,5,64,64,3])
y = TimeDistributed(KL.Conv2D(16, kernel_size=[3,3], padding='same', activation='relu'))(x)

Then an error happen
TypeError: rnn() got an unexpected keyword argument 'input_length'

If the Input layer have batch_shape=[None,5,64,64,3] or just shape=[5,64,64,3], the error will not happen. But I just want to use a stateful ConvLSTM2D layer after conv frames in each time step, so the batch size is neccesery. I don't know how to deal with this problem.

If the Input layer have batch_shape=[None,5,64,64,3] or just shape=[5,64,64,3], the error will not happen. But I just want to use a stateful ConvLSTM2D layer after conv frames in each time step, so the batch size is neccesery. I don't know how to deal with this problem.
body:
I have the same problem in TF r1.2 and Python 3.5. If I try to use tf.contrib.keras.layers.TimeDistributed, the same error happens. But if I add the code
`from tensorflow.contrib.keras.python.keras.layers.wrappers import TimeDistributed`
I can use TimeDistributed.

When I use TimeDistributed, I meet another trouble.
`from tensorflow.contrib.keras import layers as KL`
`x = KL.Input(batch_shape=[1,5,64,64,3])`
`y = TimeDistributed(KL.Conv2D(16, kernel_size=[3,3], padding='same', activation='relu'))(x)`

Then an error happen
TypeError: rnn() got an unexpected keyword argument 'input_length'

If the Input layer have batch_shape=[None,5,64,64,3] or just shape=[5,64,64,3], the error will not happen. But I just want to use a stateful ConvLSTM2D layer after conv frames in each time step, so the batch size is neccesery. I don't know how to deal with this problem.
